attributes.action: Sack the Attorney General; perhaps for incompetence, not understanding the very legislation that she pushed Parliament to pass; or perhaps for breaking the law - contrary to the Code of Conduct for Ministers; or perhaps to demonstrate that, even in this day and age, there is such a thing as honour.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Plainly the Attorney General is in the wrong.
Yet that same AG pushed for this very law to be passed - against sage advice warning of the pitfalls of presuming guilt.
And the Code for Ministers indicates that they 'must' not break the law.
Sets a bad example; gives ammunition to the Government's foes - abroad and domestically; and, politically, is inept in the extreme.
Plainly, as the AG will not go, apparently, the Prime Minister should sack her.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
